start_cursor.description: If supplied, this endpoint will return a page of results starting after the cursor provided. If not supplied, this endpoint will return the first page of results.

page_size.description: The number of items from the full list desired in the response. Maximum: 100

query.description: The text that the API compares page and database titles against.

sort.description: A set of criteria, `direction` and `timestamp` keys, that orders the results. The **only** supported timestamp value is `"last_edited_time"`. Supported `direction` values are `"ascending"` and `"descending"`. If `sort` is not provided, then the most recently edited results are returned first.

direction.description: The direction to sort. Possible values include `ascending` and `descending`.

timestamp.description: The name of the timestamp to sort against. Possible values include `last_edited_time`.

filter.description: A set of criteria, `value` and `property` keys, that limits the results to either only pages or only data sources. Possible `value` values are `"page"` or `"data_source"`. The only supported `property` value is `"object"`.

value.description: The value of the property to filter the results by.  Possible values for object type include `page` or `data_source`.  **Limitation**: Currently the only filter allowed is `object` which will filter by type of object (either `page` or `data_source`)

property.description: The name of the property to filter by. Currently the only property you can filter by is the object type.  Possible values include `object`.   Limitation: Currently the only filter allowed is `object` which will filter by type of object (either `page` or `data_source`)

start_cursor.description: A `cursor` value returned in a previous response that If supplied, limits the response to results starting after the `cursor`. If not supplied, then the first page of results is returned. Refer to [pagination](https://developers.notion.com/reference/intro#pagination) for more details.

page_size.description: The number of items from the full list to include in the response. Maximum: `100`.

start_cursor.description: If supplied, this endpoint will return a page of results starting after the cursor provided. If not supplied, this endpoint will return the first page of results.

page_size.description: The number of items from the full list desired in the response. Maximum: 100

tools.name: notion__API-get-block-children
tools.description:
[notion] Notion | Retrieve block children
Error Responses:
400: Bad request

block_id.description: Identifier for a [block](ref:block). Also accepts a [page](ref:page) ID.

children.description: Child content to append to a container block as an array of [block objects](ref:block)

after.description: The ID of the existing block that the new block should be appended after.

tools.name: notion__API-patch-block-children
tools.description:
[notion] Notion | Append block children
Error Responses:
400: Bad request

tools.name: notion__API-retrieve-a-block
tools.description:
[notion] Notion | Retrieve a block
Error Responses:
400: Bad request

type.description: The [block object `type`](ref:block#block-object-keys) value with the properties to be updated. Currently only `text` (for supported block types) and `checked` (for `to_do` blocks) fields can be updated.

archived.description: Set to true to archive (delete) a block. Set to false to un-archive (restore) a block.

tools.name: notion__API-update-a-block
tools.description:
[notion] Notion | Update a block
Error Responses:
400: Bad request

tools.name: notion__API-delete-a-block
tools.description:
[notion] Notion | Delete a block
Error Responses:
400: Bad request

filter_properties.description: A list of page property value IDs associated with the page. Use this param to limit the response to a specific page property value or values. To retrieve multiple properties, specify each page property ID. For example: `?filter_properties=iAk8&filter_properties=b7dh`.

tools.name: notion__API-retrieve-a-page
tools.description:
[notion] Notion | Retrieve a page
Error Responses:
400: Bad request

page_id.description: The identifier for the Notion page to be updated.

properties.description: The property values to update for the page. The keys are the names or IDs of the property and the values are property values. If a page property ID is not included, then it is not changed.

in_trash.description: Set to true to delete a block. Set to false to restore a block.

icon.description: A page icon for the page. Supported types are [external file object](https://developers.notion.com/reference/file-object) or [emoji object](https://developers.notion.com/reference/emoji-object).

cover.description: A cover image for the page. Only [external file objects](https://developers.notion.com/reference/file-object) are supported.

tools.name: notion__API-patch-page
tools.description:
[notion] Notion | Update page properties
Error Responses:
400: Bad request

children.description: The content to be rendered on the new page, represented as an array of [block objects](https://developers.notion.com/reference/block).

icon.description: The icon of the new page. Either an [emoji object](https://developers.notion.com/reference/emoji-object) or an [external file object](https://developers.notion.com/reference/file-object)..

cover.description: The cover image of the new page, represented as a [file object](https://developers.notion.com/reference/file-object).

page_size.description: The number of items from the full list desired in the response. Maximum: 100

tail.description: If provided, returns only the last N lines of the file

head.description: If provided, returns only the first N lines of the file

tools.name: filesystem__read_file
tools.description: [filesystem] Read the complete contents of a file as text. DEPRECATED: Use read_text_file instead.

tail.description: If provided, returns only the last N lines of the file

head.description: If provided, returns only the first N lines of the file

tools.name: filesystem__read_text_file
tools.description: [filesystem] Read the complete contents of a file from the file system as text. Handles various text encodings and provides detailed error messages if the file cannot be read. Use this tool when you need to examine the contents of a single file. Use the 'head' parameter to read only the first N lines of a file, or the 'tail' parameter to read only the last N lines of a file. Operates on the file as text regardless of extension. Only works within allowed directories.

tools.name: filesystem__read_media_file
tools.description: [filesystem] Read an image or audio file. Returns the base64 encoded data and MIME type. Only works within allowed directories.

paths.description: Array of file paths to read. Each path must be a string pointing to a valid file within allowed directories.

tools.name: filesystem__read_multiple_files
tools.description: [filesystem] Read the contents of multiple files simultaneously. This is more efficient than reading files one by one when you need to analyze or compare multiple files. Each file's content is returned with its path as a reference. Failed reads for individual files won't stop the entire operation. Only works within allowed directories.

tools.name: filesystem__write_file
tools.description: [filesystem] Create a new file or completely overwrite an existing file with new content. Use with caution as it will overwrite existing files without warning. Handles text content with proper encoding. Only works within allowed directories.

oldText.description: Text to search for - must match exactly

dryRun.description: Preview changes using git-style diff format

tools.name: filesystem__edit_file
tools.description: [filesystem] Make line-based edits to a text file. Each edit replaces exact line sequences with new content. Returns a git-style diff showing the changes made. Only works within allowed directories.

tools.name: filesystem__create_directory
tools.description: [filesystem] Create a new directory or ensure a directory exists. Can create multiple nested directories in one operation. If the directory already exists, this operation will succeed silently. Perfect for setting up directory structures for projects or ensuring required paths exist. Only works within allowed directories.

tools.name: filesystem__list_directory
tools.description: [filesystem] Get a detailed listing of all files and directories in a specified path. Results clearly distinguish between files and directories with [FILE] and [DIR] prefixes. This tool is essential for understanding directory structure and finding specific files within a directory. Only works within allowed directories.

sortBy.description: Sort entries by name or size

tools.name: filesystem__list_directory_with_sizes
tools.description: [filesystem] Get a detailed listing of all files and directories in a specified path, including sizes. Results clearly distinguish between files and directories with [FILE] and [DIR] prefixes. This tool is useful for understanding directory structure and finding specific files within a directory. Only works within allowed directories.

tools.name: filesystem__directory_tree
tools.description: [filesystem] Get a recursive tree view of files and directories as a JSON structure. Each entry includes 'name', 'type' (file/directory), and 'children' for directories. Files have no children array, while directories always have a children array (which may be empty). The output is formatted with 2-space indentation for readability. Only works within allowed directories.

tools.name: filesystem__move_file
tools.description: [filesystem] Move or rename files and directories. Can move files between directories and rename them in a single operation. If the destination exists, the operation will fail. Works across different directories and can be used for simple renaming within the same directory. Both source and destination must be within allowed directories.

tools.name: filesystem__search_files
tools.description: [filesystem] Recursively search for files and directories matching a pattern. The patterns should be glob-style patterns that match paths relative to the working directory. Use pattern like '*.ext' to match files in current directory, and '**/*.ext' to match files in all subdirectories. Returns full paths to all matching items. Great for finding files when you don't know their exact location. Only searches within allowed directories.

tools.name: filesystem__get_file_info
tools.description: [filesystem] Retrieve detailed metadata about a file or directory. Returns comprehensive information including size, creation time, last modified time, permissions, and type. This tool is perfect for understanding file characteristics without reading the actual content. Only works within allowed directories.

tools.name: filesystem__list_allowed_directories
tools.description: [filesystem] Returns the list of directories that this server is allowed to access. Subdirectories within these allowed directories are also accessible. Use this to understand which directories and their nested paths are available before trying to access files.

observations.description: An array of observation contents associated with the entity

tools.name: memory__create_entities
tools.description: [memory] Create multiple new entities in the knowledge graph

from.description: The name of the entity where the relation starts

to.description: The name of the entity where the relation ends

tools.name: memory__create_relations
tools.description: [memory] Create multiple new relations between entities in the knowledge graph. Relations should be in active voice

entityName.description: The name of the entity to add the observations to

contents.description: An array of observation contents to add

tools.name: memory__add_observations
tools.description: [memory] Add new observations to existing entities in the knowledge graph

entityNames.description: An array of entity names to delete

tools.name: memory__delete_entities
tools.description: [memory] Delete multiple entities and their associated relations from the knowledge graph

entityName.description: The name of the entity containing the observations

observations.description: An array of observations to delete

tools.name: memory__delete_observations
tools.description: [memory] Delete specific observations from entities in the knowledge graph

relations.description: An array of relations to delete

from.description: The name of the entity where the relation starts

to.description: The name of the entity where the relation ends

tools.name: memory__delete_relations
tools.description: [memory] Delete multiple relations from the knowledge graph

tools.name: memory__read_graph
tools.description: [memory] Read the entire knowledge graph

query.description: The search query to match against entity names, types, and observation content

tools.name: memory__search_nodes
tools.description: [memory] Search for nodes in the knowledge graph based on a query

names.description: An array of entity names to retrieve

tools.name: memory__open_nodes
tools.description: [memory] Open specific nodes in the knowledge graph by their names

launchOptions.description: PuppeteerJS LaunchOptions. Default null. If changed and not null, browser restarts. Example: { headless: true, args: ['--no-sandbox'] }

allowDangerous.description: Allow dangerous LaunchOptions that reduce security. When false, dangerous args like --no-sandbox will throw errors. Default false.

tools.name: puppeteer__puppeteer_navigate
tools.description: [puppeteer] Navigate to a URL

selector.description: CSS selector for element to screenshot

encoded.description: If true, capture the screenshot as a base64-encoded data URI (as text) instead of binary image content. Default false.

tools.name: puppeteer__puppeteer_screenshot
tools.description: [puppeteer] Take a screenshot of the current page or a specific element

selector.description: CSS selector for element to click

tools.name: puppeteer__puppeteer_click
tools.description: [puppeteer] Click an element on the page

tools.name: puppeteer__puppeteer_fill
tools.description: [puppeteer] Fill out an input field

selector.description: CSS selector for element to select

tools.name: puppeteer__puppeteer_select
tools.description: [puppeteer] Select an element on the page with Select tag

selector.description: CSS selector for element to hover

tools.name: puppeteer__puppeteer_hover
tools.description: [puppeteer] Hover an element on the page

tools.name: puppeteer__puppeteer_evaluate
tools.description: [puppeteer] Execute JavaScript in the browser console
